Comment:
Hi everyone!

I could not resist annotating this game which was a Team Match between the Master Mater and Master Bastalex.  As you can see, what will come is an awesome display - a successful mating attack against somebody near his own rating!

I hope we will all learn something from it.  Master Bastalex kicks off with 1. c4 which is the English Opening.  c4 hits out at the central square d5.
2. Nf3 - fairly standard development in the English Opening although sometimes g3 is played here.
2. Nf3 - fairly standard development in the English Opening although sometimes g3 is played here.
4. Nxd4 - pawn trade.
4. Nxd4 - pawn trade.
4. Nxd4 - pawn trade.
4. Nxd4 - pawn trade.
5. Nc2 - white's knight retreats to c2 after Freddy's pawn stab.
5. Nc2 - white's knight retreats to c2 after Freddy's pawn stab.
5....... b5 - a pawn sac. I wonder what Freddy is up to here?  Hmm, maybe to lure the c4 pawn away from controlling d5 so that Freddy can plonk his own pawn on it.
6. ..... Bb7 - it is becoming very clear, Freddy wants first grabs of the a8-h1 diagonal for his light square bishop.
6. ..... Bb7 - it is becoming very clear, Freddy wants first grabs of the a8-h1 diagonal for his light square bishop.
7. Nc3 - white now tries to get his pieces out.  The pawn on b5 is protected.
9. ....... 0-0 - after nabbing control of the centre, Freddy now tucks his king away safely on the wing.
9. ....... 0-0 - after nabbing control of the centre, Freddy now tucks his king away safely on the wing.
9. ....... 0-0 - after nabbing control of the centre, Freddy now tucks his king away safely on the wing.
9. ....... 0-0 - after nabbing control of the centre, Freddy now tucks his king away safely on the wing.
9. ....... 0-0 - after nabbing control of the centre, Freddy now tucks his king away safely on the wing.
12. f3 - presumably to stop a black knight landing on e4 later on.  Another possibility is to prepare e4 for himself undermining Freddy's centre.
12. f3 - presumably to stop a black knight landing on e4 later on.  Another possibility is to prepare e4 for himself undermining Freddy's centre.
12. f3 - presumably to stop a black knight landing on e4 later on.  Another possibility is to prepare e4 for himself undermining Freddy's centre.
12. f3 - presumably to stop a black knight landing on e4 later on.  Another possibility is to prepare e4 for himself undermining Freddy's centre.
12. f3 - presumably to stop a black knight landing on e4 later on.  Another possibility is to prepare e4 for himself undermining Freddy's centre.
12. ..... Nbd7 - Freddy now 1. Develops his b8 knight.  2.  Clears the decks between his two rooks.  3.  Reinforces the e4 square.
14. ...... exd4 - interesting, after white castles there is a pawn trade on the square d4.  this opens up some lines and Freddy sacrifices another pawn.......
14. ...... exd4 - interesting, after white castles there is a pawn trade on the square d4.  this opens up some lines and Freddy sacrifices another pawn.......
14. ...... exd4 - interesting, after white castles there is a pawn trade on the square d4.  this opens up some lines and Freddy sacrifices another pawn.......
14. ...... exd4 - interesting, after white castles there is a pawn trade on the square d4.  this opens up some lines and Freddy sacrifices another pawn.......
15. ...... Qe3+ - so that his queen can just Get Into the Groove!
15. ...... Qe3+ - so that his queen can just Get Into the Groove!

16. Kh1 - yup, those pawn trades/sac made a fine groove for Freddy's queen to just get on in there - that is something I must be on the lookout for when I next play him!  White has only two legal moves, Kh1 or Rf2.  As it is not desirable to put your pieces into a pin then Kh1 is the logical choice here.
16. ....... Qh6 - this move puts Master Bastalex in Old Matey's shadow, look to the square h2 brethren!
17. f4 - blocks off the dark squared bishop's line to h2.  This block keeps white's kingside castled position as intact as possible.  Freddy, however, just whips that pawn right orf!
18. ..... Qxf4 - now Freddy is exchange for a pawn up.
18. ..... Qxf4 - now Freddy is exchange for a pawn up.
18. ..... Qxf4 - now Freddy is exchange for a pawn up.
19. ...... Ne5 - the black pieces are flying towards white's king like vultures awaiting dinner!
19. ...... Ne5 - the black pieces are flying towards white's king like vultures awaiting dinner!
21. Qxd5 - white tries to relieve the pressure with a knight trade, but Freddy does not take no for an answer - where there's a will, there's a way as far as he is concerned.
21. Qxd5 - white tries to relieve the pressure with a knight trade, but Freddy does not take no for an answer - where there's a will, there's a way as far as he is concerned.
21. Qxd5 - white tries to relieve the pressure with a knight trade, but Freddy does not take no for an answer - where there's a will, there's a way as far as he is concerned.
22. Bc4 - counter-attack though, will it work?  Freddy now trades off white's attacking knight for his bishop which is not doing anything much at the moment.
22. Bc4 - counter-attack though, will it work?  Freddy now trades off white's attacking knight for his bishop which is not doing anything much at the moment.
23. ....... Rad8 - Freddy now brings his QR into play which attacks the WQ.
